column2: Product Manager- Merchant Acquiring (UPI, POS) will be someone who has technical depth, who can navigate complex product workflows, and understand the core components we need to build in reaching our next product milestones.                    We are seeking an experienced Product Manager who will play a key role in successfully implementing iServeUs merchant acquiring strategy by supporting the end-to-end product management life cycle.          The right candidate will be a subject matter expert and passionate advocate for payments digitization and for driving merchant acceptance of digital payments products with a strong and differentiated customer value proposition.                        Responsibilities:            Lead the end-to end merchant acquiring product lifecycle management.                Build products: Collaborate with engineering team to build UPI and POS acquiring products that customers love. Produce high-quality product specifications and effectively prioritize and manage the scope of each product launch to deliver products and features on time.                Launch products: Draft and execute a go-to-market plan in conjunction with Product Marketing. Be the internal and external authority and advocate for your given area of focus.                Understand the market landscape, show curiosity by seeking out market and customer insights, and seek to translate these into product opportunities.                Develop Cost-Volume-Profit (CVP) based solutions to support the launch and growth of the merchant acquiring business.                Deliver innovative ideas to leverage the iServeUs merchant acquiring platform and add value-based solutions to the payments business.                Perform analysis and provide data-informed input into the product road map, develop product features, write clear, concise and comprehensive functional requirements, and coordinate project management and implementation activities.                Conduct data analysis and modelling to support informed recommendations for product pricing.                Collaborate effectively across functions, including Technology, Operations, Marketing, and Sales, to deliver integrated strategies for target customers.                Build and maintain strong relationships with merchant acquiring and other key business relationships to achieve key milestones.                Cultivate a seamless customer experience by ensuring the smooth functioning of automated and manual processes.                Define and scope new product ideas leveraging internal technology and external vendor solutions                Keep management well-informed of project progress, issues, risks, and product performance.                Manage internal compliance and reporting requirements as required.                Consistently drive projects and initiatives to completion and towards achieving key performance indicators and targets.                                        Requirements          Desired Qualifications/ knowledge:                Bachelors degree in a related field (e.g., Finance, Business, or Computer Science). MBA or relevant advanced degree is a plus.                Deep understanding as a product person in Payment Regulatory Norms, Payment flows of UPI, Cards, Wallets and Net Banking, POS payment collections, dynamic QR collections, card based payment collections and overall payment ecosystem.      (This skillset is Mandatory)                Solid knowledge of agile methodologies, with experience working in cross-functional Agile teams.                Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex business requirements into actionable product features.                Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.                Proven track record of delivering high-quality products on time and within budget.                Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.                Familiarity with compliance and regulatory requirements in the fintech industry is a plus.                Prior experience in merchant acquiring systems, API integrations, or payment gateways is highly desirable.                Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development and web technologies                        Benefits      Employee Health Insurance                          Competitive Salaries                          Flexible Working hour                          Guest house facility                          Fooding Facility                          Well facilitated Cafeteria                          Favorable Work Environment                          Sports Events                          Equal Opportunity                          Transparent Evaluation                          Ongoing training and educational opportunities                          Career development                          product and industry trainings

column2: Project Role : Product Owner Project Role Description : Drives the vision for the product by being the voice of the customer, following a human-centered design approach. Shapes and manages the product roadmap and product backlog and ensures the product team consistently deliver on the clients needs and wants. Validates and tests ideas through recurrent feedback loops to ensure knowledge discovery informs timely direction changes.  Must have skills : Software Product Management Good to have skills : Business Requirements Analysis, Group Benefits Pensions & Annuities Minimum  3  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Bachelor of science Summary :As a Product Owner, you will be responsible for driving the vision for the product by being the voice of the customer, following a human-centered design approach. Your typical day will involve shaping and managing the product roadmap and product backlog, ensuring the product team consistently delivers on the clients' needs and wants, and validating and testing ideas through recurrent feedback loops to ensure knowledge discovery informs timely direction changes.  Roles & Responsibilities: Lead the product team in developing and executing the product roadmap and product backlog, ensuring that the team consistently delivers on the clients' needs and wants. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, and marketing, to ensure that the product vision is aligned with the company's overall strategy. Drive the product development process, following a human-centered design approach and validating and testing ideas through recurrent feedback loops to ensure knowledge discovery informs timely direction changes. Manage the product backlog, prioritizing features and requirements based on customer feedback, market trends, and business goals. Communicate the product vision and roadmap to stakeholders, including executives, customers, and the product team, ensuring that everyone is aligned and working towards the same goals. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Strong experience in Software Product Management. Good To Have Skills:Experience in Group Benefits Pensions & Annuities, Business Requirements Analysis. Solid understanding of Agile methodologies and product development processes. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to use data to inform product decisions. Experience in managing and prioritizing product backlogs, with a focus on delivering value to customers. Experience in working with product development teams, including engineering, design, and QA. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 3 years of experience in Software Product Management. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science, engineering, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering successful products. This position is based at our Bengaluru office. Qualification Bachelor of science
column11: business requirement analysis, product development, product vision, software product management, agile methodology, project management, data validation, business analysis, product roadmap, marketing, product management, scrum, agile

column2: To strengthen our IT Hub in Bangalore, we are looking for an    IT Product Owner    within our    Data Analytics Products and Services    (DAPS) product group for HR        In this position, you will work closely with IT, portfolio management and the HR function, internal & external development teams and business teams to specify, plan, design and develop, deploy and sustain high-performing HR analytics products at scale, in order to delight our business stakeholders and receivers                              What you will do                                Engage with Product Managers, Business Analysts and Architects of IT and ADI Streams for understanding the data and analytics needs of Nestl HR.                                  Partner with IT HR Stream and Corporate Function, Zone and markets to understand, analyse, translate, and document business requirements, pain points or opportunities.                                  Work with external partners, to design and build data and analytics products that deliver business value as efficiently as possible. You will deliver data models using a range of On-premise and Cloud toolsets, including SAPBW with HANA, new generation analytics platforms such as Azure, Snowflake, and PowerBI.                              You will create data and analytics products to support both standard reporting and more advanced analytics and machine learning use cases.                              You will work using waterfall and agile development methodologies, sometimes acting as Scrum Master, sometimes as Project lead, sometimes also being the lead solution designer.                              Be the custodian of the data models and flows within your scope, ensuring they remain compliant with policies around data security and solution design standards and best practices.                              You will work with external and internal colleagues to ensure training materials for the Product area are documented, as well as oversee the handover to deployment and sustain teams.                              Support the development and curation of data products in the data catalogue                              Support Product Managers/Product Group Managers through the full product lifecycle from new product initiation through to product retirement.                                    What will make you successful                              Bachelors or Masters degree in computer science, engineering, maths, finance, statistics or related discipline.                          Most likely you will come from a developer background, with 10+ years experience of building data assets and pipelines to serve analytics use cases.                          Whilst capable of performing hands-on development, you are keen to progress to leading and coaching others. You are keen to drive the work of developments teams or pods to be able to create solutions at scale.                          You have a track record of delivering analytics products at scale using SAP-BW, plus newer-generation data warehousing platforms e.g. Azure services and Snowflake. Ideally you have experience of using modern front-end analytics tools such as PowerBI and SAP SAC.                          Project Management experience would be desirable, working in dispersed teams in multiple locations and using both waterfall and agile/DevOps development methodologies.                          A good understanding of data engineering and architecture standards.                          Strong experience with effective communication at different levels in the organization and in English.                          An appreciation for data democratization and the F.A.I.R data principles.                          It is preferable to have some exposure to Portfolio management and financial KPIs and domain knowledge, particularly in relation to analytics.                            Be autonomous and proactive in proposing action plans, establishing relationships and engaging with different areas of the IT organization and the business.

column2: Cloud Center of Excellence (CCoE) develops the cloud service capabilities that support Danfoss and its customers       The CCoE enables our global digital transformation, and requirements while progressing on our multi-cloud adoption journey     For CCoE we are looking for an experienced Product Owner who is passionate about maximizing the value of our cloud services by engaging and building strong collaboration with our stakeholders while representing the business requirements and empowering the organization to utilize cloud as a trusted accelerator for digital growth     You will join a dedicated team with highly skilled cloud architects and engineers that handle infrastructure at a global scale within Danfoss         This is a new position where you will play a key role in the global cloud journey     You will be working in a global cross-functional environment with close contact to many different stakeholders like; Manufacturing Technology Teams, Software Developers, and other relevant stakeholders from the business segments and Global IT           Job Responsibilities             Lead on cloud vision, purpose, and product roadmap in alignment with business objectives and technology capabilities                  Communicate and analyze business requirements and current challenges based on close dialogue with our customers                  Keep up with new and emerging cloud technologies, trends that drive innovation and continuous improvement of the cloud products                  Maintain the backlog while prioritizing based on value, risk, and dependencies to ensure a clear execution plan                  Working closely with the team to ensure understanding of vision and prioritizations in the backlog                  Drive the development and upkeep of an engaged cloud community, fostering collaboration, knowledge sharing, and best practices among stakeholders, users, and partners                  Stakeholder management and communication to the cloud community                  Acting as an evangelist for the CCoE s cloud products within the organization to maximize value             Background & Skills                 To be a great Product Owner at Danfoss you will need to have strong analytical and problem-solving skills that build on a customer focused mindset       You will further need to provide a high degree of cross-cultural collaboration, organizational and stakeholder relationship building skills, together with a technical understanding and curiosity in creating reliable, future-proof cloud solutions     It will be your role to be the face of our product within the organization and will have to take responsibility for developing cloud product roadmaps, stakeholder management for the cloud environment, clear and prioritized backlogs while engaging with and enabling your team members               The ideal candidate possesses these skills:                 5+ years of experience working as a Product Owner, Product Manager in an international organization, or similar role within cloud solutions                  Strong understanding of cloud platforms (eg, Azure, AWS, GCP)                  Ability to communicate complex technical information to non-technical stakeholders                  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a customer centric mindset                  Passionate about making useful cloud products available to the organization                  Familiar with working in an agile environment                  Experience with the ITIL framework                  Excellent stakeholder management for the product supply chain                  Effective communication skills                  Team player mindset                  A proactive approach to spotting and communicating problems, areas for improvement, and performance bottlenecks                  Experience working within a global team and organization                  Proficient in both written and spoken English

column2: Amex : Product Owner Location: Bangalore Exp: 5+yrs Intraedge is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Product Owner to join our team. The Product Owner will be responsible for owning and driving the vision, strategy, and roadmap for one or more of our key products. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in product management, excellent communication skills, and a passion for delivering exceptional user experiences. The product owner focuses on product goals and translating the product manager's strategy into actionable tasks. You need to be more tactical and detail-oriented. Responsibilities: Setting up user stories and features that meet customer needs Managing the product backlog Prioritizing features to be created Ensuring the development team is working on the most important features Communicating the product goal Representing stakeholders Helping the team stay aligned with the product roadmap Own and prioritize the product backlog, ensuring alignment with the overall product vision and strategy. Collaborate closely with stakeholders, including business leaders, customers, and development teams, to gather requirements and define product features. Translate business requirements into clear user stories with detailed acceptance criteria. Continuously monitor and analyze product performance metrics, making data-driven decisions to optimize the product. Act as the voice of the customer, advocating for their needs and ensuring their feedback is incorporated into the product roadmap. Keep abreast of industry trends and competitor offerings to identify opportunities for innovation and differentiation. Skills & Qualifications: JIRA; Rally; Microsoft Office Suite; Product Management; Project Management, background in Financial services. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams. Proven track record of successfully delivering products from concept to launch. Experience working with project management and collaboration tools such as Jira and Confluence. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt quickly to changing priorities. About Intraedge:  https://intraedge.com/   Intraedge is a Technology, Products and Learning Organization, It was founded in 2002 with offices in the US, India, Europe, Canada, and Singapore. We provide our clients with the resources and expertise to enhance business performance through technology.? About American Express: https://www.americanexpress.com/   American Express is a globally integrated payments company, providing customers with access to products, insights and experiences that enrich lives and build business success. Via the worlds largest integrated payments platform, we provide safe, reliable and convenient ways to make payments and process transactions, connecting millions of customers and businesses around the world.?

column2: Function as a Product Owner in an Agile environment for multiple Agile teams. Collaborate closely with product and engineering teams to create, maintain, and prioritize items in product backlogs and roadmaps. Work closely with teams to refine tickets, including adding story points for work estimation. Scope out and conduct the user acceptance testing with the QA team before release. Actively participate in Scrum events. Research business requirements and engage with both internal and external stakeholders. Write business requirements, workflow diagrams, and user stories with acceptance criteria for developers and testers to follow in JIRA. Collaborate closely with Tech Leads to manage Scrum ceremonies, including grooming, sprint planning, sprint burn-down, and retrospectives. Ability to demonstrate new product capabilities to both internal and external stakeholders. Demonstrate a proven ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with multiple projects and deadlines, utilizing effective organizational and time management skills, and attention to detail. Contribute to building and empowering a strong community of Product Owners. Create documentation using Confluence. Coordinate and communicate with various stakeholders. Perform other duties as assigned. Education and Experience: Educational background in Software Engineering, Product Management, or a related field. A minimum work experience of 8+ years in a software/SaaS company. A minimum of 4+ years of experience functioning within Agile teams as a Product Owner or in a similar project management role. Proven experience in Agile Scrum methodologies. Technical Skills: Experience in writing and understanding technical requirements for SaaS products. Competence in using Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and other productivity tools. A strong grasp of APIs and microservices in the context of SaaS-based software products. Should have a solid understanding of tools like JIRA, Aha, and Postman. Preferred experience with SQL and Python. Additional desired Skills (Nice to have):  Agile certifications (Nice to have): CSM (Certified ScrumMaster) CSPO (Certified Scrum Product Owner) SAFe Agile (Scaled Agile Framework) PMP (Project Management Professional)

column2: The Product Owner is responsible for the definition and delivery of a part of a product from a customer and market requirement point of view - regarding content, prioritization, quality and customer excitement for a given cost and time frame.     Responsible for a part of the product through the product life cycle from the definition to the phase-out.     Provides the associated development teams with priorities and expertise regarding the product and ensures completeness and consistency of the derived requirements within the part of the product.     Responsible for definition and delivery of a part of a product from a customer and market requirement point of view, working with one or several development teams.      Internal Interactions: Product Line Manager, Product Manager, Project Manager, Quality Manager, Development Team (e.g. Scrum Master, System Analyst, Architect, Developers, Testers), Usability Engineer, other stakeholders (e.g. Business Units),Technical Writers.     External Interactions: Collaborative customers, Customers, Cardiologists, Sonographers, Hospital Administrators and IT Administrators etc.       What are my tasks       Elicit and collect stakeholder requests     Define and prioritize Market Requirements along with Product Managers.     Analyze Market Requirements (e.g. initiate and manage concepts for complex Market Requirements)     Derive, prioritize and communicate Software Requirements     Create Software Requirement Specifications (i.e. problem part)      Coach/ support development teams questions and resolve conflict regarding features and requirements     Analyze and decide complaints and charms      Achieve commitments with and motivate development teams, assist development teams in attaining maximum effective sustainable pace for development     Ensure quality by evaluating results of iterations and either approve/ accept or reject results based on DONEness criteria     Support effort estimations of development teams     Analyze change request entries and prioritize with other product backlog items     Coordinate cross-feature-area development with peers to facilitate prioritized product development     Deliver input for project management     Support roll-out of the system, presentation, workshops, training for sales and engineering       What do I need to know to qualify for this job     Qualification: A Bachelors / masters degree in engineering and / or MCA or equivalent.     Work Experience: 12 to 15 years     Desired Knowledge Experience:       Healthcare market. Product knowhow and customer understanding     Sound knowledge of Clinical Workflows and Healthcare IT, especially in the area of Cardiology.     Healthcare Industry standards like DICOM, IHE and HL7     Good understanding of software systems categorized as Medical Device     Basic understanding of Legal regulations and standards applicable for medical devices, affecting safety aspects(i.e. FDA 21CFR820QSR, ISO 13485)     Exposure to agile methodology     Good programming skills should have worked for a majority of time in software programming roles.     Thorough experience in Requirements Engineering, Usability Engineering and feature definition activities.     Product Lifecycle Management Software development cycle experience     Integration with different 3rd party applications.       What experience do I need to have       Professional: Several years of experience in the medical device/ healthcare industry (e.g. as a Product Owner, System Engineer, System Analyst, Technology Lead, Lead Architect etc.), expertise in clinical and radiological workflows, experience in image processing. column2: Department:  Product Management Job Type:  Internship Duration -  6 Months with an option for a full-time role (performance-based) Summary:  As a Product Intern, you will play a crucial role in supporting the development and launch of innovative projects within our organization. You will work closely with the Product team, collaborating with cross-functional teams to bring new ideas to life. This internship provides a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in product management, market research, and project coordination. Key Responsibilities: Market Research: Conduct market research to identify potential opportunities and trends in the industry. Present findings to the product team to inform decision-making. Idea Generation: Collaborate with team members to brainstorm and generate new product ideas. Talk to users and external stakeholders to identify problems to solve. Participate in ideation sessions and contribute creative insights. Product Development: Assist in the development and refinement of product concepts. Work closely with the product team to create user stories, wireframes, and specifications. Participate in product testing and gather user feedback. Analyze feedback data to identify areas for improvement and optimization. Qualifications: Current enrollment in a Bachelor's or Master's degree program, preferably in Business, Marketing, Engineering, or a related field. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and teamwork abilities. Proactive and self-motivated with a strong desire to learn. Familiarity with product management and UX concepts/tools is a plus.

column2: We are seeking a highly motivated and enthusiastic    Product Management Intern    to join our team.   Eccentric s Mission    We are building a Showroom-like experience in a virtual world where a vehicle buyer       Can take a 3D walkthrough of all models/variants/trims on sale         Can customize the vehicle and see exactly how it looks like and how much it will cost         Can take a Virtual Consultation with a sales agent in the virtual world (some like to call it Metaverse)     What you ll do      Assist in managing the entire product life cycle, from feature/process planning to tactical activities to drive usage and adoption         Conduct market research to identify customer needs, potential challenges, and quantifiable opportunities. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.         Experience with Design and/or product management software (such as Whimsical, Figma, Notion, JIRA Confluence) is a plus.

column2: Product Vision and Strategy:        Define and communicate a clear product vision, roadmap, and strategy for RD systems platforms, aligning with overall company goals and market trends. Continuously monitor industry trends, regulatory changes, and customer feedback to identify opportunities for product improvements.            Product Backlog Management:        Maintain and prioritize the product backlog for RD systems platforms, ensuring that user stories and requirements are clearly defined, properly sized, and aligned with the product vision and regulatory requirements.            Stakeholder Collaboration and Communication:        Act as the primary point of contact for stakeholders, gathering requirements, feedback, and insights to ensure that platforms meet their needs and address regulatory concerns. Effectively communicate product decisions, roadmaps, and progress to stakeholders, fostering transparency and building trust.            Release Planning and Execution:        Develop and maintain a product roadmap, coordinating with cross-functional teams for testing, validation, and user acceptance to ensure product quality and regulatory compliance.            Risk Management and Compliance:        Ensure that RD systems platforms comply with relevant regulatory requirements, industry standards, and best practices. Identify and mitigate potential risks associated with product development, implementation, and maintenance.            Platform Compliance:        Collaborate closely with relevant stakeholders to ensure that solutions, such as Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS), Electronic Laboratory Notebooks (ELN) etc are developed by the requirements of 21 CFR Part 11 and systems validation standards, ensuring regulatory compliance and data integrity.            Continuous Improvement:        Continuously seek opportunities for process optimization, system enhancements, and user experience improvements. Analyze product performance metrics, user feedback, and industry benchmarks to identify areas for improvement.                  Qualifications and Requirements:              Bachelors degree in a relevant field; master s degree preferred.          7+ years of experience with RD systems platforms within the life sciences or consumer healthcare industry.          Comprehensive knowledge of Quality Assurance and regulatory compliance, including 21 CFR Part 11 and FDA regulations.          Strong problem-solving capabilities and a track record of successful project delivery.          Proven experience in product management, with a strong understanding of RD processes and regulatory requirements.          Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and problem-solving skills.          Ability to translate complex regulatory requirements and business objectives into actionable product requirements.          Proficiency in Agile methodologies and experience working in cross-functional teams.                  Soft Skills:              Strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.          Demonstrated conflict resolution problem-solving skills.          Adaptability and openness to change.          Team player, service oriented.          Analytical and synthetic, with strong writing skills.          Leadership attitude, autonomy, and results driven.          Role model our values: teamwork, integrity, respect, courage.                  Education:        Bachelor s degree in a relevant field; master s degree preferred. Proven experience (7+ years) within the life sciences or consumer healthcare industry.                Languages:        Fluent spoken and written English.

column2: Product Manager- Merchant Acquiring (UPI, POS) will be someone who has technical depth, who can navigate complex product workflows, and understand the core components we need to build in reaching our next product milestones.                    We are seeking an experienced Product Manager who will play a key role in successfully implementing iServeUs merchant acquiring strategy by supporting the end-to-end product management life cycle.          The right candidate will be a subject matter expert and passionate advocate for payments digitization and for driving merchant acceptance of digital payments products with a strong and differentiated customer value proposition.                        Responsibilities:            Lead the end-to end merchant acquiring product lifecycle management.                Build products: Collaborate with engineering team to build UPI and POS acquiring products that customers love. Produce high-quality product specifications and effectively prioritize and manage the scope of each product launch to deliver products and features on time.                Launch products: Draft and execute a go-to-market plan in conjunction with Product Marketing. Be the internal and external authority and advocate for your given area of focus.                Understand the market landscape, show curiosity by seeking out market and customer insights, and seek to translate these into product opportunities.                Develop Cost-Volume-Profit (CVP) based solutions to support the launch and growth of the merchant acquiring business.                Deliver innovative ideas to leverage the iServeUs merchant acquiring platform and add value-based solutions to the payments business.                Perform analysis and provide data-informed input into the product road map, develop product features, write clear, concise and comprehensive functional requirements, and coordinate project management and implementation activities.                Conduct data analysis and modelling to support informed recommendations for product pricing.                Collaborate effectively across functions, including Technology, Operations, Marketing, and Sales, to deliver integrated strategies for target customers.                Build and maintain strong relationships with merchant acquiring and other key business relationships to achieve key milestones.                Cultivate a seamless customer experience by ensuring the smooth functioning of automated and manual processes.                Define and scope new product ideas leveraging internal technology and external vendor solutions                Keep management well-informed of project progress, issues, risks, and product performance.                Manage internal compliance and reporting requirements as required.                Consistently drive projects and initiatives to completion and towards achieving key performance indicators and targets.                                        Requirements          Desired Qualifications/ knowledge:                Bachelors degree in a related field (e.g., Finance, Business, or Computer Science). MBA or relevant advanced degree is a plus.                Deep understanding as a product person in Payment Regulatory Norms, Payment flows of UPI, Cards, Wallets and Net Banking, POS payment collections, dynamic QR collections, card based payment collections and overall payment ecosystem.      (This skillset is Mandatory)                Solid knowledge of agile methodologies, with experience working in cross-functional Agile teams.                Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex business requirements into actionable product features.                Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.                Proven track record of delivering high-quality products on time and within budget.                Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.                Familiarity with compliance and regulatory requirements in the fintech industry is a plus.                Prior experience in merchant acquiring systems, API integrations, or payment gateways is highly desirable.                Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development and web technologies                        Benefits      Employee Health Insurance                          Competitive Salaries                          Flexible Working hour                          Guest house facility                          Fooding Facility                          Well facilitated Cafeteria                          Favorable Work Environment                          Sports Events                          Equal Opportunity                          Transparent Evaluation                          Ongoing training and educational opportunities                          Career development                          product and industry trainings
column11: Computer science, Product management, Health insurance, Career development, Data analysis, Project management, Analytical, SMS, Product marketing, CRM

column1: PS Category Business Management Product Owner
column2: Job Summary This role is responsible for developing and executing plans to optimize processes and capabilities for PS Category specialized on Business Reviews.  The role works closely with PS Category WW and Markets and collaborates cross-functionally with other units like Supply Chain and Finance, and leverages data analytics and project management methodologies to drive transformations.  The role monitors performance metrics, identifies complex trends, and provides regular reports to leadership to support organizational growth. Responsibilities In collaboration with PS Category leads develops and executes comprehensive strategic plans for the enhancement and optimization of business reviews around processes and capabilities throughout the organization, contributing to long-term competitive advantage. Collaborates cross-functionally to ensure seamless integration and alignment of processes and capabilities with the organization's overarching strategic goals. Gathers business requirements and translates them into user stories following company standard agile methodologies and tools. Owns the processes and capabilities around business reviews and integrates them into the overall roadmap of Category business planning and operations with other Product Owners and Architects. Coordinates the development of capabilities interacting with multiple teams from developers to business leaders. Utilizes advanced data analytics and predictive modeling to identify complex trends, patterns, and opportunities, driving transformative process improvements, substantial cost savings, and revenue growth. Implements cutting-edge project management and quality improvement methodologies to optimize processes. Identifies and manages risks associated with process and capabilities change to ensure business continuity, regulatory compliance, and strategic risk mitigation. Serves as a mentor and advisor to junior team members, actively cultivating their professional growth and fostering a culture of excellence within the team. Manage the operations around business reviews, including monitoring, correcting, enhancing, and managing change with PS Category stakeholders. Education & Experience Recommended Four-year or Graduate Degree in Sales, Marketing, Business Administration, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence. Typically has 7-10 years of work experience, preferably in business operations, business process improvement, change management, or a related field. Preferred Certifications Project Management Professional (PMP) Knowledge & Skills Excellent project management skills and proven history of managing complex projects Experience with agile methodology, ideally certified as scrum master Analytical thinking and understanding of Business Planning solutions and concepts Ability to lead complex process improvements using industry standard quality improvements tools and concepts Excellent program management, problem solving, and analytical skills, and the ability to execute a program within the scope of overall strategies. Thorough understanding of change management processes and procedures Superior communication skills (i.e. written, verbal, presentation), leadership, consulting, influence, and negotiation skills. Mastery in English and local language as well as other languages as required. Strong financial and PS category business acumen. Cross-Org Skills Effective Communication Results Orientation Learning Agility Digital Fluency Customer Centricity Impact & Scope Impacts function and leads and/or provides expertise to functional project teams and will participate in cross-functional initiatives. Shift - No shift premium (Spain) Travel - 25%.
column11: Business Management, project management, data analytics, business process improvement, predictive modeling, agile, business operations

column2: Work closely with the Product, Tech, Data, Finance, Marketing, and Sales teams to understand business performance, and define metrics and KPIs.     Obsess about user problems and solve real user problems.     Identify opportunities to unlock growth and efficiency in each business function.     Build dashboards and reports to create visibility into different funnels and business processes.     Design and run A/B tests.     Use your data superpowers to explore our rich data, and propose new features and products.     As an early team member, build our data culture and infrastructure as the team grows.         Requirements         You love digging into datasets to validate hypotheses and uncover insights.     You have strong SQL and Excel skills, and have experience working with relational databases, ETL pipelines, and BI tools. Experience with a scripting language is a plus.     You take end-to-end ownership of your work and are comfortable working across different business functions.     You put users first and empathize with how they'll use Recur. Your work reflects this.     Experience designing and running A/B tests, and prior work in finance is a plus.     You have a champion mindset and you are always eager to learn new skill sets.         Benefits         Ownership: We want you to feel like an owner that will reflect in your salary and equity     Resources: The best in class equipment for you to excel at work     A good work-life balance: we do our best work when we're balanced     Flexible vacation and work hours: We dont adopt conventional work practices that are meaningless for the type of work we do     Great colleagues: We value a culture of authenticity, humility, and excellence. We want you to make a footprint on our culture
column11: Product management, Excel, Sales, Equity, Management Intern, SQL, Scripting

column2: Help define the vision, strategy, and roadmap for the products you ll be responsible for.                          Constantly analyse data, test, and iterate, with a very datadriven mindset.                          Gather insights on product adoption/improvements, track KPIs, identify key metrics and propose further iterations.                          Assist on initiatives/ features discovery, digging into analysis around features.                          Support the product manager to track and improve key product metrics. Provide recommendations based on indepth data analysis and clearly outline its impact on key product metrics.                          Support with documenting, reviewing, and tracking product development.                          Suggest and help develop gotomarket strategy, digital marketing strategies to increase customer base.                          Be a paragon of our values by fostering a fantastic atmosphere within the teams.                              Who are you?                              Holding any degree in a managementrelated field, Business Analytics, or Information Systems, preferably with an understanding of product marketing.                          Someone who is switching careers or looking to begin a career in product management.                          Someone with excellent prioritisation and organisational skills, with excitement for the idea of managing multiple responsibilities in parallel.                          You re structured and creative enough to solve most challenging problems independently, given the necessary knowledge. You learn new concepts and skills rapidly and look to understand stuff truly indepth.                          You re datadriven with a strong ability in analyzing data to derive insights and make decisions.                          Curious about metrics, execution processes, and macro trends.

column2: Role & responsibilities     Product      Roadmap Management : Develop and manage multiple      roadmaps for supply chain execution systems. Support market research,      competitor analysis and feature requests from customers Product      Roadmap Prioritization and Planning :      Collaborate with product, engineering, and sales teams to plan and      prioritize the current and future product sprints. Ensure alignment with      product vision and goals User      Stories Development : Translating and analysing      requirements to Epics. Develop user stories and acceptance criteria based      on stakeholder input and requirement gathering. Support development of      product documentation, release notes, BRDs, and user guides User      Interviews :  Conduct user interviews      and usability tests to develop actionable insights Product      Monitoring : Develop and monitor product      KPIs and identify improvement areas. Ensure product features are aligned      with product vision and meeting QA standards and customer expectations Communication:  Connect      regularly with stakeholders, engineering, QA and customers to provide      product updates and solicit feedback. Communicate product features,      functionalities, SLA expectations to stakeholders Sales      & Marketing Support:  Responsible for      co-developing content for product marketing and support the sales team for      product demos and RFPs Preferred candidate profile     Bachelors or      Masters degree in the one of the following  Industrial Engineering,      Computer Science, Supply Chain, Business Administration or related fields. 6+ years of      work experience in product management and knowledge of best practices and      working for international companies is a plus. 4+ years of      working in warehouse operations or domain knowledge of Warehouse Management Systems (WMS), and      Inventory Management Systems. Excellent      problem solving and critical thinking skills Ability to      work under pressure and deliver quality work in time-critical situations Stay      connected to new innovations in the Supply Chain Executions systems space      and bring these innovations into the product. Ability to      perform in a fast-paced, high-stress environment under minimal      supervision. Evidence of      solving large-scale problems for customers. Ability to take complex      concepts and simplify them for the customer. Outstanding      written and verbal communication skills. Strong ability to communicate      solution concept ideas through sketches, and wireframes. Experienced      and comfortable with presenting work to executives and large groups,      customers. Strong ability to communicate complicated concepts and bring      clarity to stakeholders and team members. Self-motivated,      able to work independently but also collaborative and driven by group      critique.   Location - Pune

column2: As a Product Owner for ONESOURCE, you will work with a broad set of Business and IT stakeholders with focus on the TAX ( Input Output) to understand business needs and coordinate the process and system capabilities required to support those business needs.          You will be responsible for solution design and serve as a functional and thought leader for the SAP platform in the SaaS Subscription domain.          You will play a key role inCompanys SAP ERP transformation, including design,fit-gap and integrations.          You will collaborate with Finance, Order Management, Products and Pricing cross-functional teams and lead the development efforts to create system solutions based on a deep understanding of business requirements.          You will also work with a dynamic, global hybrid team of product owners and engineers responsible for rapidly evolving the systems and processes supporting our Finance and Accounting functions                  Responsibilities Include:                  Working with external partners to define overall program requirements within the product scope, budget, and timelines          Documents capability level requirements working with internal stakeholders and their priorities          Resolve, document and articulate solution feasibility for short-term and long term          Build Business process model design - As-Is vs To-Be process design for capabilities and offers          Align with business architecture, business rules, policies, key business decisions, cross-program dependencies, and high level solution designs          Lead the product backlog (ie, prioritized list of user stories)          Lead requirement gathering sessions with business team members in Tax domain          Design build products/solutions in SAP S4 HANA FInance          Support testing strategy and plan, test scenarios          Ensure successful delivery of Program s business outcome (including specific metrics) with support from project partners          Implement and manage scope changes and interventions to ensure project goals are achieved            Requirements:                  Bachelors or Master s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Business administration or in a related field          Have Knowledge understanding in implementing tax technology solutions (eg, CorpTax, ONESOURCE, Sabrix, Vertex)          5 + years of experience in architecting and designing solutions using SAP Platform in PTP, RTR Tax domain          Hands-on implementation experience in SAP Configuration          Solution Design experience in Tax calculation          Experience defining the architecture landscape, business capability mapping, identifying gaps between current and future states, and delivering a comprehensive solution that will help achieve the business outcomes          Experience managing vendor relationships and ability to partner with them to conduct business and technical discovery          Experience working and presenting proposals to executives in a clear and compelling way          You have strong business process analysis, business modeling, process definition, data analysis and problem solving skills as well as can learn about newer business processes in a short period of time.          You are an effective communicator, can draft operational documentations and drive reviews and presentations in front of senior leaders.            Preferred Qualifications            SAP Certification          Experience in High Tech Industry SaaS Transformation          CPA / MBA
column11: Process design, Order management, Solution design, Data analysis, SAP ERP, SAP, Business solutions, Operations, PTP
